subsections.title: Texture
subsections.content: Soil texture refers to the fineness or smoothness of soil aggregates.
points: Loam: Balanced mix; ideal for crops.

subsections.title: Soil Colour
subsections.content: Helps identify soil types and fertility.
points: Affected by organic matter, moisture, and parent material.

subsections.title: Soil Temperature
subsections.content: Degree of hotness or coldness in soil.
points: Affects germination, microbes, root growth, soil formation.

subsections.title: Soil Depth
subsections.content: Thickness of soil above the parent material.

subsections.title: Soil Structure
points: Types: Blocky, Cuboidal, Columnar, Prismatic, Granular, Platy, Crumb, Single Grain.

subsections.title: Soil Consistency
subsections.content: Ease of crushing soil by fingers/tools based on moisture.

subsections.title: Soil Porosity
subsections.content: Amount of pore space in soil.
points: Porosity = Volume of pores ÷ Total volume × 100.

subsections.title: Maintaining Soil Structure
subsections.content: Practices that maintain structure and fertility.

subsections.title: Soil pH
subsections.content: Measure of acidity or alkalinity of soil.
points: Managed through liming or sulfur application.

subsections.title: Cation Exchange Capacity (CEC)
subsections.content: Soil’s ability to hold and exchange nutrients.
points: Depends on clay and organic matter.
